comment: We started with live models the first week of class and got right to work. I grew a lot because I got to do so much drawing in his class. He does assign HW every week so get ready to draw a LOT and he does require attendance. He gives until the end of the semester to turn in late HW though so he gives plenty of time to receive an A in his class.

Professor Brotherton will take any project up until the last day of class for a 10-point deduction max, which is perfect for anyone with a tight schedule who finds themself needing to prioritize assignment completion at times. Also, you only have to build 1 canvas in his Painting I class, unlike Remillard who makes you build ALL your canvases.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Brotherton was very kind. The critiques we did during class were very helpful and he answered any questions we had. Attendance is mandatory, but thats common for a lot of Chastain classes. He was also not super harsh on tardiness unless you were extra late. Just put in the work and you should be fine! His whole goal was to see us improve.

Looks for any possible reason to fail you. Uses tardiness as an excuse to drop your grade. So many things wrong with this professor, but the biggest issue being that he does not expect you to pass. Literally told me that the highest he expects from me is a B in the course. Good luck if you arent naturally talented.

He is a nice guy who grades based upon 3 categories: an early semester critique, an end of semester critique, and homework. The homework is due every week pretty much, uploaded before class. It is a little strenuous at times keeping up with the hw, but it was a really nice class. You'll have 2 unexcused absences to use. He doesn't grade harsh.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Most people did not come to class, and still got a decent grade. I tried to go all but a few times. Lectures can be a little dry, but he is a really nice guy. Easy to talk to if you have a problem or need help.

I regret buying the textbook because it is never even used. His lectures are from the notes so if you are good at note taking you dont need to buy the book. Honestly, notes are not even necessary. I have gotten A's on all the tests because he does a review day the class before a test and he goes over EVERY question. So take notes that day.

In a one-on-one environment, he is such an open book and I really relate to him. But, in a classroom environment, he would often leave early and disappear for long periods of time. He really just wants you to experiment, but his broad sense of what qualifies a piece as good can lead to you feeling like youre not functioning at full potential

Professor Brotherton is really nice. He has a hard time putting words together and explaining assignments but just read the documents he uploads and you'll be fine. There are a lot of assignments but he gives more than enough time to work on them. He is very OCD about mounting so make sure your work is centered properly or he will take off points.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Okay teacher. Allows students to miss 2 days of class before he begins to deduct points. There's a chance for extra credit with a paper.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Okay teacher. Allows students to miss 2 days of class before he begins to deduce points. There's a chance for extra credit with a paper.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Brotherton is a fine teacher, but I often felt like I was stumbling through the class and not really being taught anything. He's great and you will learn a lot but if you are already talented and looking to sharpen your skills another professor would be better. Overall, he is great and helpful when asked one on one.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He was a really nice teacher but he's a tough grader. I small mistake on an assignment brought my grade down a letter (on the assignment not the class). Overall he's a great professor to take if you are looking to challenge yourself or if you want to improve your art.
Awesome professor, wants you to learn to do better! Great critiques.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Brotherton was a very good choice for my ART1150 class. He gives good feedback and makes you work for that grade. This class requires a lot of effort but if you want to be good that is required.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a really nice guy, but I don't think he is the best teacher. When asking him questions one on one, he can be very helpful. But when addressing the whole class, he doesn't always get his point across. He can be a tough grader and might not be the best if you don't already know what you're doing. But he does care that you succeed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I have no respect for this professor as an artist or a teacher. He is a terrible communicator and never does demos for the class to actually see what he is talking about or expecting of us. He leaves the class confused on what they are to do. Students need natural talent to do well in his class because he will not teach you strategies to succeed.

Brotherton is a fantastic professor. He was always willing to help and gave great feedback. His class consisted of mostly in class work/studio days. There was no final exam. At first he can seem tough or cold, but he is just a serious person!!!

Do NOT take this class at 8AM like I did... this professor admitted to not being a morning person and he was extremely dry and uninteresting and often seemed like he'd rather be anywhere else. I use 'teaching' loosely... it's a lot of self-learning. He really challenges your skill as an artist and your ideas of what art is.

This class made drawing fun for me and I truly enjoyed the class. There is little note taking and no required book, it's more of in-class work assignments. I will say that if you don't start your projects early, it will be hard to cram. If you don't give effort, you will not pass. Otherwise, fun class, funny and cool professor. Take his class :D

The first day of class this professor said, "I don't believe in A's." I'm not sure if this was supposed to be a challenge or what, but no one received an A in the class. His grading system was not good, a person who put forth 1hr of effort would be given a grade 4 points below a person who put forth 2 weeks worth of effort (efforts shown).

What an outstanding guy. Really cares about students, will find ways to make students who aren't any good, feel like Picasso. Has great things to say about everyones stuff. But will have helpful and useful tips when needed. Projects are fun, his grading is more than fair. Take him if you can!!!!

Brotherton is an awesome professor, I took him for my first drawing class. Mostly from life drawing, which seems straightforward, but he really opens your eyes. He definitely helped me see things better from life and gives great tips on how to capture  the subject. Very enjoyable class, never feels as long as it is. I looked forward to going.
He is by far my favorite teacher I have had this year. He tests your skill, but is very helpful and nice. If you love drawing, he is s great role model and teacher.
He is a great professor. His assignments are clear and he is willing to help any way he can. He gives a lot of creative freedom in the drawings. Very nice guy as well.

Very passionate! He really opens your mind to reality beyond just art. Although the class can get boring, it is still tolerable and you can listen to music and he will answer any questions you may have.

This class is kind of boring, but only because most artists don't want to draw still life material. but if you listen and read the book you can actually learn new techniques. Prof. Brotherton is really amazing and challenges you to think about drawing and art life.  If you work hard for your grade, he will give you what you deserve. i recommend him
This class was a very easy if you attend the review days and take the 3 tests, the presentation is easy along with the other two assignments. EASY A!

Prof Brotherton makes you visually see art in a different light.  I had some interest before this class, now I am obsessed.  Not an art major, but thinking of it as a "Minor".  3-tests, no final. Go to the reviews and you will get an "A" on all tests.  Presentations are easy. Take him, you will enjoy the class!

This class is very easy. Attendance is not mandatory. I attended class only on test days, test review days, and the day my project was to be presented and still managed to get an A. Only 3 tests, 2 assignments, and a project. I would recommend this professor to anyone. Careful about cheating on tests though, very strict.

He tries to be fair in his grading.  From what I hear, it's better to take his drawing class as opposed to some of the other professors.  If you show initiative and effort you will be fine.  Be prepared to participate.

I really enjoyed this professor. He was really easy and his grading was fair. Be sure to do the reading before class cause he expects everyone to talk during discussion. I would recommend him. Really chill guy. allows somewhat late work and absences with explanation. EASY!

Extremely frustrating. Very pretentious. Think "Dead Poets Society" minus the charm. Dominates "class" discussions with drivel. Can be a decent person when he's not teaching. Otherwise, annoying, pretentious, arrogant, etc. Don't like him.
